summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons incident report documenting Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It records the discovery of Epstein with a homemade rope around his neck and notes a pending disciplinary hearing for self-mutilation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, by using a homemade rope around his neck. He is the subject of the incident report and a pending disciplinary hearing for self-mutilation.

persons.name: M. Rice
persons.context: The admitting officer listed on the prison incident report for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Nicholas
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the time of the suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

connections.description: Nicholas was Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center when Epstein attempted suicide on July 23, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade rope around his neck in an apparent suicide attempt.

events.title: Incident Report Filed
events.description: A prison incident report was filed documenting Epstein's suicide attempt and noting a pending disciplinary hearing for self-mutilation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, by using a homemade rope around his neck while incarcerated.
The incident report was filed on July 29, 2019, and notes a pending disciplinary hearing (DHO) for code 228: self-mutilation.
Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident was an inmate named Nicholas.
The document is part of case number NYM-19-0061, categorized as a threat assessment.
